ai.summary: The Dolaucothi Woodland Trail is an 8.9 km woodland hike in the UK, offering shaded forest paths, birdsong and a peaceful environment. The route suits walkers with some hiking experience and a reasonable fitness level, with moderate effort and well-marked trails throughout.
ai.terrain_summary: Trail surfaces are a mix of compact earth and gravel, with occasional damp sections and exposed roots. Expect gentle rolling terrain with small elevation changes, and occasional muddy patches or uneven footing; parts of the route may include small wooden boardwalks or stepping stones.
ai.safety_notes: Weather in the UK can change quickly, so wear sturdy waterproof footwear and bring a layer for rain. Stay on marked paths, watch for slippery roots and muddy sections, and be cautious near streams. Carry a map or GPS, a charged phone, water and snacks, and inform someone of your planned return. Plan for shorter daylight hours in winter and be mindful of other trail users.
recommended_gear: Sturdy hiking boots or trail shoes
Headlamp or flashlight (in case of late return)
ai.best_seasons: Spring to autumn for milder weather and better trail conditions; winter visits are possible but expect mud, reduced daylight, and colder conditions.

seo.title: Dolaucothi Woodland Trail – 8.9 km Moderate Hike in the UK
seo.meta_description: Explore the Dolaucothi Woodland Trail, an 8.9 km moderate hike through UK woodlands. Learn about terrain, safety tips, gear recommendations, and the best seasons to hike.
